geninfo.para: Radiators and their supports are often rubber mounted to provide extended life. This can result in radiators and their supports not being electrically grounded to the vehicle chassis. If a body builder or user mounts an electrical device to the radiator or support, the ground return path may be through the coolant to the engine, which is grounded. Current through the coolant will cause electrolytic corrosion of the radiator resulting in rapid radiator failure. The degree of electrolytic corrosion varies with the type of electrical device and the length of time the device is normally activated.

Mounting electrical devices to radiators or their supports is not recommended.However, if necessary to do so, it is recommended that a 10 gauge ground cable be added between any electrical device mounted to the radiator or its supports and the frame or engine. Care must be taken to insure that paint or rust is removed to insure a good ground. A protective grease should be applied to prevent corrosion of the electrical connection.
